reviewText: I did this work-out a few times and got familiar with the moves, and now I mix it in with my normal routine every now and then just for a change of pace. It's not intense at all- the moves take some getting used to if you're a "hula beginner" like me; I'm also not the most graceful, but I caught on pretty quick. The instructors, and the scenery are beautiful! Just have fun with this! (My dog thought it was pretty funny watching me!)
summary: Something different to add to your work-out!
Title: N/A

reviewText: The Island Girl series is my favorite go-to set of workouts in winter.  The workouts are fun, feeling more like dance than an exercise class. That's really the best thing about them.  They are some of the few exercise dvds I've tried that have me looking forward to working out when I would otherwise be tempted to be a couch potato.  I particularly like the Tahitian Cardio for the emphasis on hip work and the graceful movements in it.On the technical end, it has what I look for in a workout dvd.  There is a warm up and cool down.  Kili teaches "mirror" style so it is easier to follow along.  The camerawork shows the full body unless it is appropriate to zoom in to show the movement in detail.  It is filmed outdoors against a beautiful Hawaiian background.  The music is an upbeat traditional sounding Tahitian drum piece that really sets the mood.The intensity level is moderate.  I tend to use this the most after the holidays when I have been in an exercise lull.  It is just the right amount to get me sweating without me thinking "Enough already!"  There are some standard aerobic exercise movements in it to work more muscle groups.  While I would have preferred just dance movements, the aerobic ones are kept to a minimum and serve a purpose.This may not be to the taste of people who are hardcore fitness or hardcore Tahitian dance buffs, but for the average person like me, it's a great way to keep motivated to keep moving.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I use to do Tahitian Dancing so I thought I would use this to shed some post baby weight. The dvd is ok...but its no substitute for class. Its fun though for anyone interested in testing out Tahitian dancing.

reviewText: I had this DVD for a while and today was my first time doing it. I love this DVD. This is my third DVD that I have done from the Island Girl series. The instructions are easy to follow. The workout is for 30 minutes. Before I knew it, I was finished with the exercise. It was fun. My legs really did get a good workout.I will be doing this workout again soon.

reviewText: I thought I'd try this DVD because of all the great reviews. Long ago, I also had a friend who hula-danced and I always enjoyed watching the performances and practices. I love this workout! Kili is a great instructor, very graceful and not at all annoying. I can't wait to be able to shake my butt like those girls (I guess the technical term is "'umi")...sexy! Now don't think you'll be able to do this workout on the very first try. I expect it will take me at least another 3 or 4 viewings before I can get the moves and the routine down. But I'm up to the challenge, if my legs don't fall off first (my thighs were already screaming at me shortly after beginning the workout)!
summary: LOVE IT! LOVE IT! LOVE IT!

reviewText: i got this dvd because of my love for dancing in general coupled with the fact that i had knee surgery in march, so i can't run.  this dvd is really great for abs, but i use it with my brazilian dance workout in order to add more cardio.  if you have knee problems, i would definitely recommend stretching a little before starting the workout. seriously though, it does good things for the abdominal region!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Basically you learn four different kinds of hip movements.  Some of these are similar to bellydance if you have done that before.  These include:  hip circles, hip bumps side to side, figure 8s, and another side to side movement.  These movements are combined with walking side to side or back/front, or pivoting in a circle.  Simple arm movements are added as well.  Every once and awhile, she'll add some traditional fitness moves without hip movements (grapevine, step touch, squats, hops).  Then the hip movements will be added on.My heart rate didn't get up very high as the movements are generally done slowly.  The workout is very good for toning though, as many of the movements are done in squat position and really burn the legs.  What frustrated me the most was the coordination aspect--I found it really difficult to do some of the hip movements while stepping forward and back.  I'm just not that coordinated or used to isolating this area.  It's also tough to catch on to the subtle differences in hip movements that she teaches you.  I didn't catch on to everything the first time I did the DVD but I'm getting better.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I ended up with this video as a mistake by B&N (I had ordered another dvd, but got this one).  I really enjoyed it however.  I think it's a great way to burn some calories and get off the couch.  I wouldn't say it's the best cardio workout, and I wouldn't use it to target and tone trouble spots, but it's still a great way to get moving.  I use this in a series of fitness dvds to stay active and help maintain my fitness level.  Kili is a fun instructor, and you really do get a nice workout from the dvd.
summary: Fun way to get your body in motion

reviewText: this is a great setting to do a workout, it was a great set of routines that were easy and fun, i really enjoyed this

reviewText: This video is a challenge. I have not worked out at all in a VERY long time and I am over weight and out of shape. This video seem's to be fun, like the other viewer's have said, BUT, don't expect it to be a cake walk. I just did the video for the first time today and I could only do about 5 minutes and after that my legs were so shaky and burning that I had to stop. There is alot of squating involved in this video, which one viewer said there wasn't, but there is. I watched the whole video before I did it and there is ALOT of squating, that's how your able to move your hip's the way the instructor show's you to. Also, there is a brief hopping move, but this you could probably just not do and keep moving through it (which the same viewer that said there was no squating or kneeling also said there was no hopping, did they even watch this video?) I did love the music it's very cultural and "get's you moving" Good drum beat. I just think they should rename this video for intermediate level and not begginer. It's defanitly NOT a begginer video. I will have to do little by little of this video each time to try to complete it. 4 stars because it's "begginer" title is misleading, but I loved the music and moves.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Easy to follow instructions, although it's hard to tell if you have the mechanics right unless you're in front of a mirror.  The instructor is easy to understand, but it's obvious that it will take years of practice and probably every video in the series to be as gracful as Kili and the other girls.....watching them, you realize just how much muscle control this takes.  I did start feeling a lot more fluid after a few tries.  Not really a sweatfest, but a good break from more strenuous workouts.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is now one of my favorite workouts. Kili starts off simple and slowly makes the dance moves more challenging. She has a way of demonstrating them without making me feel like she is "talking down" to me. The music, the scenery, the outfits, are all beautiful, and the workout is definitely intense. I now find myself practicing the "figure 8" and "ami" while walking around my house!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Here again is wonderfully fit Kili in a nifty outfit with her nice assistants, squinting into the sun as she takes us too quickly through a new dance form with not enough introductory material.  Maybe those who are more fluent in dancercize and know a little about Tahitian dance will appreciate this workout more -- I am choreography-challenged I guess and would have liked to see some introductory footage about Tahitian dance (about which all I knew was that it was more active than hula supposedly) and then maybe more time practicing some traditional movements.  Kili teaches what she calls a combination of Tahitian dance and hip hop, but I really didn't know, aside from the hip things which she told us were Tahitian dance based, which were which.  About all I personally use this workout for is a warmup to do other exercises, and I can only get about halfway through it.  Kili is in great shape and must know her stuff -- I wish she'd make some more basic and informative workouts.
summary: How about more about Tahitian dance?
Title: N/A

reviewText: Out of all of the Island Girl DVDs I own, this one is my favorite.  Although I don't work up a sweat using the other Island Girl DVDs, this one I usually do!  (I consider the Island Girl hula videos to be more toning in nature for the abs and legs and use them as such...I don't count the Island Girl DVDs as "cardio" per se).Some good music, good moves.  My only qualm is that during the final dance the music doesn't "quite" match up with what's happening on screen.  Kili and the girls are just a bit faster than the music, so near the end of the final dance I have to ignore what the girls are doing and just follow the audio.Fun stuff though, and (as with all of the Island Girl DVDs) I can Really feel my abs and hips working!Recommend to beginners/low intermediates
Title: N/A

reviewText: I've not done the dance-workout dvd's long, and now, I have fallen in love with them! I have almost the whole Island Girl series! This was the most recent one that I purchased and I like this one the best. The moves she teaches you, you probibly will never do in a club but I think it's fun anyway:) In this w/o you are moving your hips almost the entire time so it works out those 'love handles'! My sister and I agree that this one is harder (aerobically b/c it's a quicker pace) but the dance moves are easier to learn. The only one that I can't master yet is the umi that is x10 the speed of all the other dvd's. Kili says in the intro not to worry about it, eventually you'll be up to speed:)In all the dvd's there is an intro, play feature, scene selection, bonus features, audio features, and credits. Within the bonus features there are the bonus proformance, play w/o with music only (no comentary), and trailers of her other w/o dvd's.Don't go into this thinking you'll learn an authentic hula dance. All of the Island Girl w/o's are all primarily w/o dvd's using hula moves/steps.

reviewText: I enjoy this workout, it's relaxing, great for a beginner and I think you can get a good core workout and strong thighs, but it's really not cardio at all.  The scenery is beautiful, but the moves don't always match the drum beats.  I've lost inches in the waist pretty quickly with this dvd, but it's not something to be done daily, it would be a bit boring.  I do this dvd when I am looking for relaxation and stress reduction. Something different.

reviewText: I was looking to spice up my work out routine and was surprisingly impressed with this DVD.  I've done everything from Yoga to Tae Bo and Zumba, and while you won't work up a huge sweat, I did find myself working up a light sweat.  I could really feel it in my thighs and abs.  I now have a greater appreciation for hula dancers.  I think with anything it will take repetition to master, but I really did not find anything too over challenging.  The instruction is well paced and moves build upon one another until you do the final sequence a few times.  The moves are beautiful and will get you in touch with the island goddess that you are.  : )The work out is about 30 minutes with warm up and cool down which is just about right.

reviewText: This is my favorite dance/exercise dvd!!The dvd shows the short tahitian routine that you will learn in the dvd.  Then you have a small warmup.  From there, Kili breaks down movements and steps and incorporates exercise elements like a grapevine, squats or a fitness hop.  During this time you are actually doing hula moves and getting a very good workout (esp for the legs).  I'm a beginner and was able to pick up the moves fairly quickly, though I am still reluctant to incorportate my the arm movements.After the 25 min workout, kili demonstrates the dance routine again with vocal cues, then demonstrates the dance twice more without the vocal cues.  Then you there is a cooldown and stretching session.In this video you will learn to roll your hips, do the figure eight, the tahitian bump, and the pookie, or hip raises.  It's really great fun!!  I have ordered other Island Girl dvds!!

reviewText: Kili continues to be mesmerizing with more hip action dancing, that's Tahitian style. When previewing the video, one already is enticed to move because of the wonderful native music, the gorgeous location and her 2 assistants! Tahitian style is faster than the hula dancing, so this is a good workout. Kili teaches you the names of each dance movement, breaks it down and at the end you get to perform the whole dance! reviewText: this tape is great. it was my first introduction to Kili and her fitness programs. she's a wonderful teacher. the workout itself is concentrated on moving the hips and doing some squats. if you practice this tape regularly you will find that your hip movements become very fluid and that you start to develop some serious muscles in the abs, glutes and quads. some of the moves can be a bit tricky, such as 3 steps to the left & right while doing figure 8's and moving arms across & overhead simultaneously. just keep doing it! the music is great, the scenery is beautiful & the dancers are inspiring. highly recommended.
summary: a wonderful hip workout! great for bellydancers!

reviewText: This can be a good workout, but again, Kili puts too much lap-dance style in her dancing. This is not a culture that adds that type of added movement. It is a "sensual" dance, not a "sexy" dance...there is a difference. Also, I am not sure if any of the others, who rated this so highly have actually made it through to the end, because nobody has mentioned the fact that there are 8 beats of music and dance steps left out of the last run through! Not only that, but the last time through doesn't keep time with the music! But, with that said, if you know Tahitian dance and can take out the added vugarity, memorize the dance, and ignore the dancers on the last run, you will have a fun work out!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is one of my favorite workout DVDs. If you are familiar with belly dancing moves, you will learn the choreography in no time. The moves are challenging, but the music is great and the cool down is soothing and relaxing. I always break a sweat with this workout, and I always feel my abs are getting a workout as well as my legs and even my arms. I gave this DVD 4 stars simply because Kili's voice is a little annoying, but the "workout to music without narration" feature is great if you just want to hear the music. This is a great addition to your weekly routine. It is not too strenous, but you will still have to work hard to perform the moves correctly, therefore you'll definitely burn some calories.
summary: Get your abs and hips burning!

reviewText: This DVD is a great workout!  I enjoyed the hula moves and really felt them in my abs and legs the next day.  The DVD is also fun to watch because the background behind the instructor is so beautiful!  I would highly recommend this DVD for anyone who wanted to try hula and get a great workout!

reviewText: Let me start by saying that I hate cardio. But I recently broke my wrist so yoga, strength training and kickboxing are, for now, not options. The thought of doing walking workouts every day creates, for me at least, a serious dread factor. So, painted into the cardio corner, I ordered several dance workouts... and this DVD was the one that struck gold. I am terribly uncoordinated but have a passing knowledge of bellydance moves thanks to Kathy Smith's Flex Appeal. And although I still can't sidestep and umi (hip circles) at the same time, that didn't stop me from working up a moderate sweat and having a blast with this workout. Perhaps practice will one day make perfect, but the reason this DVD is a keeper is that it's just plain too much fun. Kili keeps the dance routine simple with only a few moves that are repeated and combined. She also adds in a little good old fashioned cardio like pony hops to help increase your heart rate.Tahitian Cardio is the type of workout you look forward to, and I'm also looking forward to trying out more of Kili's DVDs.
summary: Too much fun to be exercise!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have never liked exercise and in particular, I hate aerobics! This DVD is different and is a wonderful and fun alternative for people like me. The scenery and music get you in a proper mood and the ladies performing the movements are great at what they do. You are not made to feel like you need to be a fence-rail thin supermodel; just someone who wants to tone and get a nice workout without crazy dance moves or jumping and swinging your body like a video diva. I highly recommend for out of the box people like me!

Kili doesn't go through the dance moves at all, but if you are familiar with Tahitian dance (and you will be if you do the Tahitian Cardio DVD), you'll have no problems. Overall, very fun--gets you warmed up for those clubs!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I did Tahitian dance years ago and always thought it was a wonderfully sensual dance form.  Now years later I wanted to try to get back into shape so like many people I wanted new fitness DVD's for the holidays.  Island Girl Dance Fitness Workout for Beginners is a *best buy* because it lives up to its name in every way.  It is an exciting dance fitness workout not too challenging for beginners, nor is it slow for those familiar with different forms of dance.  Kili is beautiful, spiritual and fit and her assistants are inspirational.  Tahitian style is appropriate for a wide age range--no jumping, kneeling work or sudden shocks for tender joints.  All and all the DVD brings the warmth of the islands and sunshine to the homes of those of us living far from the sea in cold climates.  Well done!  I'd buy another of her DVD's in a heart beat and highly recommend this DVD.
summary: Inspirational Tahitian Intro.  Makes Fitness Fun

The time seems to fly by when I am doing it.I like the moves, I like how strong she (and the back up dancers are), I like the drumming.There are only a couple of moves which are high impact, and easy to work around if you have joint issues.This is a workout that I enjoy, and would like to think that I can build up to their sensuousness, and strength, over the coming weeks.I enjoyed this and the hula abs and arms so much, that I have ordered the other two.

reviewText: I hate doing cardio so I bought this dvd. Plus I figured with all that dancing my abs may get worked too. Kili the instructor is in fantastic shape. She should make some strength training dvd's. You should see all if her muscle, I was impressed. It took a few times doing the dvd to get used to the moves which were all clearly demonstrated. After awhile my obliques were on fire. I did not sweat but this was definately fun. And Im sure the more I use this dvd over time it will slim the hips and abs. I have a feeling I was not sweating because Im not the best dancer and I was not going as fast as the girls. I think as time goes by using this dvd will help you be good at hula dancing. reviewText: I loved her since her first DVDs "Hula Workout" though those used cutsy 60s music & added 60s american dance moves but still have a lot of authetic hula dancing.These "Island Girl" hula workouts are more authentic. Just like her other ones, you get a great workout, your abs burn, your hips, legs get a nice workout. It's all authentic dance moves with some added quick squats, etc. added in so you barely notice it for adding toning. The authentic drum Hawaiian music is beautiful & does keep you stimulted too keep going just like a dance/rock beat would.I had no trouble following & learning the steps, there are plenty of dance DVDs that I have had trouble with, but she breaks everything down well & shows it slowly several times before speeding it up. She even cues YOUR left & right, not hers.There's a trailer for her "Hula Workout" DVDs & another authentic Hula workout like this called "Island Girl: Hula Abs & Buns" at collagevideo com
summary: Great authentic hula in workout form
Title: N/A

reviewText: So after trying Kili's Abs and Hips Hula DVD, I decided to give this one a whirl.  It's a damn fine workout.It took me two tries to get through this workout.  For me, that's a good thing.  I am not a dancer, so I had to work through this DVD.  It is a bit harder than the Hula Abs and Hips DVD, so it was good to have the challenge.  This workout really made me sweat, and it was a lot of fun for me to do.  If anyone has done Kili's Hula Abs and Hips DVD, you'll recognize a lot of the moves like the kaholo, hela and kao.  There are a couple of new ones, which is what I think made me have to try it a couple times to get through it.There are very few things I didn't like about this workout.  For one thing, Kili mentions "first position."  I know some dance terminology, but if you don't know what that means, she doesn't explain it.  Also, she does not explain what a plie is at all.  I only knew what it was because I know some dance terminology.  Some of the camera angles are a little silly, but at least the camera man was shooting up Kili's skirt!All in all, it's a good workout.  It's certainly help get some variety in my workouts!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I read every review and felt good about buying this with the knowledge that I wouldnt get my heart rate up, but yet this would be a good addition and change for my workout. Having done it, I really enjoy the different elements it brings to my normal step, Firm and other DVD workouts.  I get bored with traditional DVD's focusing on abs only so if you do too, you will like using this DVD for abs and legs.Yes, there are squats and the focus is to take pressure off your back during the swivels/sways and place that into your legs.  Coordination will come with time and shouldnt be a de-motivator.. whats the point of picking it up right away?  I really like the possibility of tonining my obliques, abs, legs with this 40-min workout.I can defintely see a good workout library containing all of Kili's DVD's and inserting them at least weekly through one's workout regimen for variety and a challenge.
summary: If you're looking for fun and different
